description.narrative: The incidence rate The treatment success rate The notification rate # of TB-MDR detected cases The mortality rate

comment.narrative: The incidence rate of 17 per100000 population - 2013 The treatment success rate of 84% - 2011 The notification rate of 12 per 100000 population - 2013 7 TB-MDR detected cases quarterly - 2013 The mortality rate 2.1 per 100000 - 2013

Reach the incidence rate of 17per 100000 population Reach the treatment success rate of 90% Reach the notification rate 12 per 100000 Maintain the case detection of the TB-MDR patients to 7 per quarter Reach the mortality rate of 1.4 per 100000

As per Global Tuberculosis Report 2015 by WHO: The incidence rate is 17per 100000 population The treatment success rate is 80% The notification rate is 19 per 100000 The case detection rate of the TB-MDR patients to 31 in 2014 The mortality rate is <0.1 per 100000

Reach the incidence rate of 17per 100000 population Reach the treatment success rate of 90% Reach the notification rate 15 per 100000 The case detection of the TB-MDR 20 patients Reach the mortality rate of 2.1 per 100000

The incidence rate is 17per 100000 population The treatment success rate is 60% The notification rate is 19 per 100000 The case detection rate of the TB-MDR patients :10 The mortality rate is <0.1 per 100000

description.narrative: Restoration of disrupted livelihoods of affected residents and displaced people including returnees in East Aleppo through rehabilitation of basic services and revival of local businesses and affected vocational workshops.
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of females benefitting from diversified livelihoods opportunities through UNDP emergency projects
Number of males benefitting from diversified livelihoods opportunities through UNDP emergency projects
Total number of people benefitting from diversified livelihoods opportunities through UNDP emergency projects
Number of new emergency jobs created for women 15+ years of age through UNDP projects in crisis or post-crisis settings
Number of new emergency jobs created for men 15+ years of age through UNDP projects in crisis or post-crisis settings
Total number of new emergency jobs created for adults 15+ years of age through UNDP projects in crisis or post-crisis settings

Basic and social services infrastructure rehabilitation: improve access to basic services, enhance resilience of affected communities, and improve living conditions and accelerate return of IDPs through rehabilitation of basic and social infrastructure,
seat of a first-order administrative division
